title: Rule
text: For purposes of section38, in the case of an eligible small employer, the small employer health insurance credit determined under this section for any taxable year in the credit period is the amount determined under subsection(b).

logical_structure.result: For purposes of section38, in the case of an eligible small employer, the small employer health insurance credit determined under this section for any taxable year in the credit period is the amount determined under subsection(b).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(a)General Rule—For purposes of section38, in the case of an eligible small employer, the small employer health insurance credit
                  determined under this section for any taxable year in the credit period is the amount
                  determined under subsection(b).

title: Insurance Credit Amount
text: Subject to subsection(c), the amount determined under this subsection with respect to any eligible small employer is equal to 50 percent (35 percent in the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer) of the lesser of——the aggregate amount of nonelective contributions the employer made on behalf of its employees during the taxable year under the arrangement described in subsection(d)(4)for premiums for qualified health plans offered by the employer to its employees through an Exchange, or—the aggregate amount of nonelective contributions which the employer would have made during the taxable year under the arrangement if each employee taken into account under paragraph(1)had enrolled in a qualified health plan which had a premium equal to the average premium (as determined by the Secretary of Health and Human Services) for the small group market in the rating area in which the employee enrolls for coverage.
conditions: each employee taken into account under paragraph(1)had enrolled in a qualified health plan which had a premium equal to the average premium (as determined by the Secretary of Health and Human Services) for the small group market in the rating area in which the employee enrolls for coverage.

if: each employee taken into account under paragraph(1)had enrolled in a qualified health plan which had a premium equal to the average premium (as determined by the Secretary of Health and Human Services) for the small group market in the rating area in which the employee enrolls for coverage.
logical_structure.result: Subject to subsection(c), the amount determined under this subsection with respect to any eligible small employer is equal to 50 percent (35 percent in the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer) of the lesser of——the aggregate amount of nonelective contributions the employer made on behalf of its employees during the taxable year under the arrangement described in subsection(d)(4)for premiums for qualified health plans offered by the employer to its employees through an Exchange, or—the aggregate amount of nonelective contributions which the employer would have made during the taxable year under the arrangement

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(b)Health Insurance Credit Amount—Subject to subsection(c), the amount determined under this subsection with respect to any eligible small employer
                  is equal to 50 percent (35 percent in the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer)
                  of the lesser of—I.R.C. § 45R(b)(1)—the aggregate amount of nonelective contributions the employer made on behalf of its
                     employees during the taxable year under the arrangement described in subsection(d)(4)for premiums for qualified health plans offered by the employer to its employees
                     through an Exchange, orI.R.C. § 45R(b)(2)—the aggregate amount of nonelective contributions which the employer would have made
                     during the taxable year under the arrangement if each employee taken into account
                     under paragraph(1)had enrolled in a qualified health plan which had a premium equal to the average
                     premium (as determined by the Secretary of Health and Human Services) for the small
                     group market in the rating area in which the employee enrolls for coverage.

text: Such amount multiplied by a fraction the numerator of which is the total number of full-time equivalent employees of the employer in excess of 10 and the denominator of which is 15.

logical_structure.result: Such amount multiplied by a fraction the numerator of which is the total number of full-time equivalent employees of the employer in excess of 10 and the denominator of which is 15.

                     full-time equivalent employees of the employer in excess of 10 and the denominator

text: Such amount multiplied by a fraction the numerator of which is the average annual wages of the employer in excess of the dollar amount in effect under subsection(d)(3)(B)and the denominator of which is such dollar amount.

logical_structure.result: Such amount multiplied by a fraction the numerator of which is the average annual wages of the employer in excess of the dollar amount in effect under subsection(d)(3)(B)and the denominator of which is such dollar amount.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(c)(2)—Such amount multiplied by a fraction the numerator of which is the average annual
                     wages of the employer in excess of the dollar amount in effect under subsection(d)(3)(B)and the denominator of which is such dollar amount.

title: General
text: The term “eligible small employer” means, with respect to any taxable year, an employer——which has no more than 25 full-time equivalent employees for the taxable year,—the average annual wages of which do not exceed an amount equal to twice the dollar amount in effect under paragraph(3)(B)for the taxable year, and—which has in effect an arrangement described in paragraph(4).

logical_structure.result: The term “eligible small employer” means, with respect to any taxable year, an employer——which has no more than 25 full-time equivalent employees for the taxable year,—the average annual wages of which do not exceed an amount equal to twice the dollar amount in effect under paragraph(3)(B)for the taxable year, and—which has in effect an arrangement described in paragraph(4).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(d)(1)In General—The term “eligible small employer” means, with respect to any taxable year, an employer—I.R.C. § 45R(d)(1)(A)—which has no more than 25 full-time equivalent employees for the taxable year,I.R.C. § 45R(d)(1)(B)—the average annual wages of which do not exceed an amount equal to twice the dollar
                        amount in effect under paragraph(3)(B)for the taxable year, andI.R.C. § 45R(d)(1)(C)—which has in effect an arrangement described in paragraph(4).

title: General
text: The term “full-time equivalent employees” means a number of employees equal to the number determined by dividing——the total number of hours of service for which wages were paid by the employer to employees during the taxable year, by—2,080.Such number shall be rounded to the next lowest whole number if not otherwise a whole number.

                           employees during the taxable year, byI.R.C. § 45R(d)(2)(A)(ii)—2,080.Such number shall be rounded to the next lowest whole number if not otherwise a whole

title: Hours Not Counted
text: If an employee works in excess of 2,080 hours of service during any taxable year, such excess shall not be taken into account under subparagraph(A).
conditions: an employee works in excess of 2,080 hours of service during any taxable year, such excess shall not be taken into account under subparagraph(A).

if: an employee works in excess of 2,080 hours of service during any taxable year, such excess shall not be taken into account under subparagraph(A).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(d)(2)(B)Excess Hours Not Counted—If an employee works in excess of 2,080 hours of service during any taxable year,
                        such excess shall not be taken into account under subparagraph(A).

title: Of Service
text: The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Labor, shall prescribe such regulations, rules, and guidance as may be necessary to determine the hours of service of an employee, including rules for the application of this paragraph to employees who are not compensated on an hourly basis.

logical_structure.result: The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Labor, shall prescribe such regulations, rules, and guidance as may be necessary to determine the hours of service of an employee, including rules for the application of this paragraph to employees who are not compensated on an hourly basis.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(d)(2)(C)Hours Of Service—The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of Labor, shall prescribe such regulations,
                        rules, and guidance as may be necessary to determine the hours of service of an employee,
                        including rules for the application of this paragraph to employees who are not compensated
                        on an hourly basis.

title: General
text: The average annual wages of an eligible small employer for any taxable year is the amount determined by dividing——the aggregate amount of wages which were paid by the employer to employees during the taxable year, by—the number of full-time equivalent employees of the employee determined under paragraph(2)for the taxable year.Such amount shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $1,000 if not otherwise such a multiple.

logical_structure.result: The average annual wages of an eligible small employer for any taxable year is the amount determined by dividing——the aggregate amount of wages which were paid by the employer to employees during the taxable year, by—the number of full-time equivalent employees of the employee determined under paragraph(2)for the taxable year.Such amount shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $1,000

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(d)(3)(A)In General—The average annual wages of an eligible small employer for any taxable year is the
                        amount determined by dividing—I.R.C. § 45R(d)(3)(A)(i)—the aggregate amount of wages which were paid by the employer to employees during
                           the taxable year, byI.R.C. § 45R(d)(3)(A)(ii)—the number of full-time equivalent employees of the employee determined under paragraph(2)for the taxable year.Such amount shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $1,000 if not otherwise
                           such a multiple.

title: , 2011, 2012, And 2013
text: The dollar amount in effect under this paragraph for taxable years beginning in 2010, 2011, 2012, or 2013 is $25,000.

logical_structure.result: The dollar amount in effect under this paragraph for taxable years beginning in 2010, 2011, 2012, or 2013 is $25,000.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(d)(3)(B)(i)2010, 2011, 2012, And 2013—The dollar amount in effect under this paragraph for taxable years beginning in 2010,
                           2011, 2012, or 2013 is $25,000.

title: Years
text: In the case of a taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2013, the dollar amount in effect under this paragraph shall be equal to $25,000, multiplied by the cost-of-living adjustment under section1(f)(3)for the calendar year, determined by substituting “calendar year 2012” for “calendar year 2016” in subparagraph(A)(ii)thereof.

logical_structure.result: In the case of a taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2013, the dollar amount in effect under this paragraph shall be equal to $25,000, multiplied by the cost-of-living adjustment under section1(f)(3)for the calendar year, determined by substituting “calendar year 2012” for “calendar year 2016” in subparagraph(A)(ii)thereof.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(d)(3)(B)(ii)Subsequent Years—In the case of a taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2013, the dollar
                           amount in effect under this paragraph shall be equal to $25,000, multiplied by the
                           cost-of-living adjustment under section1(f)(3)for the calendar year, determined by substituting “calendar year 2012” for “calendar
                           year 2016” in subparagraph(A)(ii)thereof.

title: Arrangement
text: An arrangement is described in this paragraph if it requires an eligible small employer to make a nonelective contribution on behalf of each employee who enrolls in a qualified health plan offered to employees by the employer through an exchange in an amount equal to a uniform percentage (not less than 50 percent) of the premium cost of the qualified health plan.
conditions: it requires an eligible small employer to make a nonelective contribution on behalf of each employee who enrolls in a qualified health plan offered to employees by the employer through an exchange in an amount equal to a uniform percentage (not less than 50 percent) of the premium cost of the qualified health plan.

if: it requires an eligible small employer to make a nonelective contribution on behalf of each employee who enrolls in a qualified health plan offered to employees by the employer through an exchange in an amount equal to a uniform percentage (not less than 50 percent) of the premium cost of the qualified health plan.
logical_structure.result: An arrangement is described in this paragraph

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(d)(4)Contribution Arrangement—An arrangement is described in this paragraph if it requires an eligible small employer
                     to make a nonelective contribution on behalf of each employee who enrolls in a qualified
                     health plan offered to employees by the employer through an exchange in an amount
                     equal to a uniform percentage (not less than 50 percent) of the premium cost of the
                     qualified health plan.

title: General
text: The number of hours of service worked by, and wages paid to, a seasonal worker of an employer shall not be taken into account in determining the full-time equivalent employees and average annual wages of the employer unless the worker works for the employer on more than 120 days during the taxable year.
conditions: the worker works for the employer on more than 120 days during the taxable year.

unless: the worker works for the employer on more than 120 days during the taxable year.
logical_structure.result: The number of hours of service worked by, and wages paid to, a seasonal worker of an employer shall not be taken into account in determining the full-time equivalent employees and average annual wages of the employer

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(d)(5)(A)In General—The number of hours of service worked by, and wages paid to, a seasonal worker of
                        an employer shall not be taken into account in determining the full-time equivalent
                        employees and average annual wages of the employer unless the worker works for the
                        employer on more than 120 days during the taxable year.

title: Of Seasonal Worker
text: The term “seasonal worker” means a worker who performs labor or services on a seasonal basis as defined by the Secretary of Labor, including workers covered by section500.20(s)(1) of title 29, Code of Federal Regulations and retail workers employed exclusively during holiday seasons.

logical_structure.result: The term “seasonal worker” means a worker who performs labor or services on a seasonal basis as defined by the Secretary of Labor, including workers covered by section500.20(s)(1) of title 29, Code of Federal Regulations and retail workers employed exclusively during holiday seasons.

title: Employees Excluded
text: The term ”employee” shall not include——an employee within the meaning of section401(c)(1),—any 2-percent shareholder (as defined in section1372(b)) of an eligible small business which is an S corporation,—any 5-percent owner (as defined in section416(i)(1)(B)(i)) of an eligible small business, or—any individual who bears any of the relationships described in subparagraphs(A)through(G)of section152(d)(2)to, or is a dependent described in section152(d)(2)(H)of, an individual described in clause(i),(ii), or(iii).

title: Employees
text: The term “employee” shall include a leased employee within the meaning of section414(n).

title: Period
text: The term “credit period” means, with respect to any eligible small employer, the 2-consecutive-taxable year period beginning with the 1st taxable year in which the employer (or any predecessor) offers 1 or more qualified health plans to its employees through an Exchange.

logical_structure.result: The term “credit period” means, with respect to any eligible small employer, the 2-consecutive-taxable year period beginning with the 1st taxable year in which the employer (or any predecessor) offers 1 or more qualified health plans to its employees through an Exchange.

                     year period beginning with the 1st taxable year in which the employer (or any predecessor)
                     offers 1 or more qualified health plans to its employees through an Exchange.

title: Contribution
text: The term “nonelective contribution” means an employer contribution other than an employer contribution pursuant to a salary reduction arrangement.

title: Rules
text: All employers treated as a single employer under subsection(b),(c),(m), or(o)of section414shall be treated as a single employer for purposes of this section.

logical_structure.result: All employers treated as a single employer under subsection(b),(c),(m), or(o)of section414shall be treated as a single employer for purposes of this section.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 45R(e)(5)(A)Aggregation Rules—All employers treated as a single employer under subsection(b),(c),(m), or(o)of section414shall be treated as a single employer for purposes of this section.

title: Rules
text: Rules similar to the rules of subsections(c),(d), and(e)of section52shall apply.

logical_structure.result: Rules similar to the rules of subsections(c),(d), and(e)of section52shall apply.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 45R(e)(5)(B)Other Rules—Rules similar to the rules of subsections(c),(d), and(e)of section52shall apply.

title: General
text: In the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer, there shall be treated as a credit allowable under subpart C (and not allowable under this subpart) the lesser of——the amount of the credit determined under this section with respect to such employer, or—the amount of the payroll taxes of the employer during the calendar year in which the taxable year begins.

logical_structure.result: In the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer, there shall be treated as a credit allowable under subpart C (and not allowable under this subpart) the lesser of——the amount of the credit determined under this section with respect to such employer, or—the amount of the payroll taxes of the employer during the calendar year in which the taxable year begins.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(f)(1)In General—In the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer, there shall be treated as a credit
                     allowable under subpart C (and not allowable under this subpart) the lesser of—I.R.C. § 45R(f)(1)(A)—the amount of the credit determined under this section with respect to such employer,
                        orI.R.C. § 45R(f)(1)(B)—the amount of the payroll taxes of the employer during the calendar year in which
                        the taxable year begins.

title: Eligible Small Employer
text: For purposes of this section, the term “tax-exempt eligible small employer” means an eligible small employer which is any organization described in section501(c)which is exempt from taxation under section501(a).

logical_structure.result: For purposes of this section, the term “tax-exempt eligible small employer” means an eligible small employer which is any organization described in section501(c)which is exempt from taxation under section501(a).

requirements: an eligible small employer which is any organization described in section501(c)which is exempt from taxation under section501(a).

title: General
text: The term “payroll taxes” means——amounts required to be withheld from the employees of the tax-exempt eligible small employer under section3401(a),—amounts required to be withheld from such employees under section3101(b), and—amounts of the taxes imposed on the tax-exempt eligible small employer under section3111(b).

logical_structure.result: The term “payroll taxes” means——amounts required to be withheld from the employees of the tax-exempt eligible small employer under section3401(a),—amounts required to be withheld from such employees under section3101(b), and—amounts of the taxes imposed on the tax-exempt eligible small employer under section3111(b).

                           employer under section3401(a),I.R.C. § 45R(f)(3)(A)(ii)—amounts required to be withheld from such employees under section3101(b), andI.R.C. § 45R(f)(3)(A)(iii)—amounts of the taxes imposed on the tax-exempt eligible small employer under section3111(b).

title: Rule
text: A rule similar to the rule of section24(d)(2)(C)shall apply for purposes of subparagraph(A).

title: Credit Period Required
text: The credit shall be determined without regard to whether the taxable year is in a credit period and for purposes of applying this section to taxable years beginning after 2013, no credit period shall be treated as beginning with a taxable year beginning before 2014.

logical_structure.result: The credit shall be determined without regard to whether the taxable year is in a credit period and for purposes of applying this section to taxable years beginning after 2013, no credit period shall be treated as beginning with a taxable year beginning before 2014.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(g)(1)No Credit Period Required—The credit shall be determined without regard to whether the taxable year is in a
                     credit period and for purposes of applying this section to taxable years beginning
                     after 2013, no credit period shall be treated as beginning with a taxable year beginning
                     before 2014.

title: Of Credit
text: The amount of the credit determined under subsection(b)shall be determined——by substituting “35 percent (25 percent in the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer)” for “50 percent (35 percent in the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer)”,—by reference to an eligible small employer's nonelective contributions for premiums paid for health insurance coverage (within the meaning of section9832(b)(1)) of an employee, and—by substituting for the average premium determined under subsection(b)(2)the amount the Secretary of Health and Human Services determines is the average premium for the small group market in the State in which the employer is offering health insurance coverage (or for such area within the State as is specified by the Secretary).

logical_structure.result: The amount of the credit determined under subsection(b)shall be determined——by substituting “35 percent (25 percent in the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer)” for “50 percent (35 percent in the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer)”,—by reference to an eligible small employer's nonelective contributions for premiums paid for health insurance coverage (within the meaning of section9832(b)(1)) of an employee, and—by substituting for the average premium determined under subsection(b)(2)the amount the Secretary of Health and Human Services determines is the average premium for the small group market in the State in which the employer is offering health insurance coverage (or for such area within the State as is specified by the Secretary).

                        employer)”
                        for “50 percent (35 percent in the case of a tax-exempt eligible small employer)”,I.R.C. § 45R(g)(2)(B)—by reference to an eligible small employer's nonelective contributions for premiums
                        paid for health insurance coverage
                        (within the meaning of section9832(b)(1))
                        of an employee, andI.R.C. § 45R(g)(2)(C)—by substituting for the average premium determined under subsection(b)(2)the amount the Secretary of Health and Human Services determines is the average premium
                        for the small group market in the State in which the employer is offering health insurance
                        coverage (or for such area within the State as is specified by the Secretary).

title: Arrangement
text: An arrangement shall not fail to meet the requirements of subsection(d)(4)solely because it provides for the offering of insurance outside of an Exchange.

logical_structure.result: An arrangement shall not fail to meet the requirements of subsection(d)(4)solely because it provides for the offering of insurance outside of an Exchange.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 45R(g)(3)Contribution Arrangement—An arrangement shall not fail to meet the requirements of subsection(d)(4)solely because it provides for the offering of insurance outside of an Exchange.

title: Definitions
text: Any term used in this section which is also used in the Public Health Service Act or subtitle A of title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act shall have the meaning given such term by such Act or subtitle.

logical_structure.result: Any term used in this section which is also used in the Public Health Service Act or subtitle A of title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act shall have the meaning given such term by such Act or subtitle.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45R(h)Insurance Definitions—Any term used in this section which is also used in the Public Health Service Act
                  or subtitle A of title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act shall have
                  the meaning given such term by such Act or subtitle.

text: The Secretary shall prescribe such regulations as may be necessary to carry out the provisions of this section, including regulations to prevent the avoidance of the 2-year limit on the credit period through the use of successor entities and the avoidance of the limitations under subsection(c)through the use of multiple entities.

logical_structure.result: The Secretary shall prescribe such regulations as may be necessary to carry out the provisions of this section, including regulations to prevent the avoidance of the 2-year limit on the credit period through the use of successor entities and the avoidance of the limitations under subsection(c)through the use of multiple entities.

                  of the limitations under subsection(c)through the use of multiple entities.
